Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Mental Health Intervention in Trauma Centers

Trial_Design.evidence: In this randomized controlled trial, 171 patients with traumatic injuries were randomized

Intervention.evidence: mental health intervention (n=85) or enhanced usual care control (n=86)

Objective.evidence: This study assesses the impact of a mental health intervention on healthcare utilization and potential cost savings.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was emergency department/inpatient utilization over a 5-year follow-up.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomization was performed using a computer-generated sequence with allocation concealment.

Number_Randomised.evidence: 171 patients with traumatic injuries were randomized

Harms.evidence: No adverse events were reported in either group.
